intro: Borodinia burkii, commonly known as the Burk's borodinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia, particularly in the mountainous areas of Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of the carrot family. Borodinia burkii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments.
